info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 4:49PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Moffat County through 515 PM MDT... At 448 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles southwest of Baggs to 34 miles west of Craig. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Moffat County, including the following locations... Great Divide, Juniper Springs, Sunbeam, Fortification, Maybell and Lay. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 54 and 77. Colorado 13 between mile markers 109 and 120. Colorado 318 between mile markers 51 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
